main event: An unidentified flying object was observed by Captain Joseph M. Fahey, Jr. and two civilian employees in Weston, Missouri on 22 January 1961.
interesting points: The object was described as a red glowing light and two bright white lights closer to the ground., The sighting lasted approximately 10 minutes., The object flew over the observers, who were parked in a car in a lover's lane area., Previous sightings of the same object had occurred three or four times prior to this incident., The report suggests the object may have been a helicopter, but there was no confirmed evidence of any scheduled helicopter flights in the area.
sighted object: red glowing light and two bright white lights
witness description: Captain Joseph M. Fahey, Jr. and two civilian employees
